entry.title: Automation of foreign payments in SAP S/4HANA Could Public Edition

entry.title: How to Combine Multiple MRP Purchase Proposals and Apply Minimum Lot Size in S/4HANA Public Cloud?
entry.content:
Hi everyone

I am using SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, and I encountered an issue related to MRP purchase proposal consolidation and minimum lot size.

After running MRP, I receive multiple purchase demand elements, for example:

  • Requirement A = 20 pcs

  • Requirement B = 30 pcs

I want to combine A + B and create one purchase order.
I also want to apply a minimum lot size, for example 50 pcs.

A + B = 50 pcs → meets the minimum lot size
If the total does not reach 50, MRP should add remaining quantity.

Example:
A (20) + B (20) = 40 → System should propose 50.

Actual behavior in Public Cloud

Currently, the minimum lot size is applied per requirement, so the system creates:

  • Requirement A → 50 pcs

  • Requirement B → 50 pcs

Total = 100 pcs, which is not what we want.

Questions

  1. Is it possible in S/4HANA Public Cloud to apply minimum lot size based on the total combined quantity, not per requirement?
    → For example: A + B + additional quantity to meet the minimum lot size.

  2. In the generated Purchase Order, I cannot see the reference to the original MRP elements (e.g., MRP element number / MRP demand reference such as sales order numbers).
    Is there any configuration that allows the PO to display which MRP elements (A and B) it was created from?
    Or is this not supported in Public Cloud?

Any guidance or confirmation would be greatly appreciated.
Thank you!

entry.title: Auto-Clearing of Billing Invoices Against Credit Memos in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support Team,

Is there auto-clearing functionality in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, where billing invoices are automatically cleared against billing credit memos when both documents contain the same values? The expectation is that the clearing should take place immediately after the credit memo is posted.

In the ECC environment, this requirement was handled using Transaction Code F.13 (Automatic Clearing). We would like to confirm whether a similar functionality is available or can be configured in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.

Requesting your guidance on the following points:

  1. Is automatic clearing between billing invoices and billing credit memos supported in SAP Public Cloud?
  2. If yes, what configuration and automation options are recommended to achieve this?
  3. If not available by default, please suggest any alternative processes or automation options within SAP Public Cloud.

Kindly review and confirm the feasibility of this requirement.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: SAP Fiori UI5 Personalization Engine event attachStateChange not firing
entry.content:
I'm trying to add a column selection in view settings for sap.m.table

i have the code below where i try to attach the Engine event so when column selected changed, the function is not firing.

All i'm getting is this error - "Log-dbg.js:497 2025-12-09 17:19:39.498800 A Change was not created successfully. Reason: - No Change handler registered for the Control and Change type"

May I know what am I missing?

onInit: function () {
   this.oMetadataHelperPrint = new MetadataHelper(aColumns);

   Engine.getInstance().register(oTable, {
      helper: this.oMetadataHelperPrint,
        controller: {
          Columns: new SelectionController({
             targetAggregation: "columns",
             control: oTable,
             persistenceIdentifier: "selection-columns"
          })
        }
  });

  Engine.getInstance().attachStateChange(this.handleStateChange, this);
},

handleStateChange: function (oEvt) {
  //logic placed here
}

entry.title: Issue in Printing 7 Copies of Invoice – Item Table Not Repeating in Adobe Form (S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am working on SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, and I need to print 7 copies of the same invoice in a single PDF.

I enabled 7 occurrences for the main invoice layout, and now 7 copies are appearing correctly. However, I am facing two issues.

1. Item table does not repeat in all 7 copies

  • The header section appears in all 7 copies.

  • The item table appears only in the first copy.

  • When I place the item table inside the repeated layout, Adobe Designer shows an error and the form cannot be saved.

Because of this issue, I am unable to print the full invoice (header + items + totals) 7 times.

2. How to assign labels for each copy

Since the backend sends only one invoice, there is no copy number provided.
I plan to use the repetition index to show:

Copy 1 - Original for Recipient
Copy 2 - Duplicate for Transporter
Copy 3 - Triplicate for Supplier
Copy 4 to 7 - Extra Copy

But I need guidance on the correct way to implement this in Adobe Form.

My questions:

  1. What is the correct layout structure to repeat the full invoice (header, items, totals) 7 times?

  2. Why does the item table cause an error when placed inside the repeated layout?

  3. What is the best way to set copy labels using the repetition index?

If anyone has implemented multi-copy invoice printing in S/4HANA Public Cloud with full item data, I would appreciate your guidance.

Thank you

entry.title: How can we review costing variants (PYR1 actual costing) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public (Grow 2508)
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We are currently facing some issues in the production costing process in our SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (Grow, release 2508) system. The actual costs calculated for production orders appear incorrect, and as part of our analysis we are trying to verify every component that may influence the costing results.

During our review of production orders, we noticed that the system is using the actual costing variant PYR1 (and a planned costing variant as well). However, we have not been able to identify where in S/4HANA Cloud Public we can:

  • Display or review the definition of costing variants such as PYR1

  • Understand what parameters characterize this variant (valuation logic, costing type, date control, etc.)

  • Determine how these variants are assigned or used in production order costing

In SAP ECC, we used transaction OKKN to view costing variant configuration, but in S/4HANA Cloud Public, we cannot find an equivalent point—nor an app or configuration area that displays these predefined variants or their logic.

Our main questions are:

  1. Where can we review the definition of costing variants such as PYR1 in S/4HANA Cloud Public?

  2. Are these costing variants predefined and not editable, or is there a recommended app or configuration view to understand how they work?

  3. Which apps, configuration steps, or documentation should we refer to in order to troubleshoot issues related to production costing (planned and actual)?

Any guidance or references from SAP experts or the community would be extremely helpful, as understanding the costing variant setup is key to diagnosing our current production costing issues.

Thank you very much for your support!
